clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of an Adapted Physical Activity on the Postural Control of Residents in Nursing Home.
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Adapted Physical Activity on the Static and Dynamic Postural Control of Residents in Nursing Home: an Exploratory Study of 8 Weeks in the Réseau Santé de la Glâne (Canton of Fribourg, Switzerland).

brief_summary.textblock: This study measures the effects of an Adapted Physical Activity on postural control of residents in nursing home. Half of participants will follow a program training 3 times a week during 8 weeks, while the other half will receive the usual accompaniment.

primary_outcome.description: Measures of the center of pressure under different conditions.

secondary_outcome.measure: Habitual gait speed in meter per seconde

secondary_outcome.description: This unique test is composed of a standing balance exercise, a gait speed exercise and chair stand exercise. It gives a score of 0 to 12. 0 is the worst performance and 12 the best one.
Geriatric Depression Scale 4 items. 0 (the best) to 4 (the worst) points.
Falls Efficacy Scale International. 7 (no concern about falling) to 28 (severe concern about falling)

arm_group.description: This group will receive 3 sessions per week of specific physical activity.
This group will continue to follow the usual accompaniment of the nursing home.

intervention.description: The sessions of Adapted Physical Activity will be focus around the theme of balance, with a small part of resistance training.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Able to walk 20 meters with or without auxiliary help
- Able to stand 1 minute without help
- Health status considered stable
- Life expectancy greater than 6 months
- No major cognitive impairment preventing them from understanding a simple instruction
- No severe visual impairment
- No severe deafness
- Understanding french
- Able to discern
Exclusion Criteria:
- Unable to walk 20 meters with or without auxiliary help
- Unable to stand 1 minute without help
- Health status considered unstable
- Estimated life expectancy at less than 6 months
- Major cognitive impairment preventing them from understanding a simple instruction
- Severe visual impairment
- Severe deafness
- Not understanding french
- Inability to discern
